body:
Confirming that with this change interop image build takes about half of what it took before
```
2018-06-05 06:19:57,289 PASSED: build_docker_python [time=912.1sec, retries=0:0]
```
@matt-kwong ,  looks like I need owner's approval.

Looks like there's some python2/python3 problem for to_prod tests.
https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/918bb355-b295-4743-a47d-d469b50349ee/targets/github%2Fgrpc/tests

```
running run_interop
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "src/python/grpcio_tests/setup.py", line 106, in <module>
    test_runner=TEST_RUNNER,
  File "/var/local/git/grpc/py34_native/lib/python3.4/site-packages/setuptools/__init__.py", line 129, in setup
    return distutils.core.setup(**attrs)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/distutils/core.py", line 148, in setup
    dist.run_commands()
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/distutils/dist.py", line 955, in run_commands
    self.run_command(cmd)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/distutils/dist.py", line 974, in run_command
    cmd_obj.run()
  File "/var/local/git/grpc/src/python/grpcio_tests/commands.py", line 186, in run
    self.run_client()
  File "/var/local/git/grpc/src/python/grpcio_tests/commands.py", line 202, in run_client
    client.test_interoperability()
  File "/var/local/git/grpc/src/python/grpcio_tests/tests/interop/client.py", line 127, in test_interoperability
    test_case.test_interoperability(stub, args)
  File "/var/local/git/grpc/src/python/grpcio_tests/tests/interop/methods.py", line 512, in test_interoperability
    _jwt_token_creds(stub, args)
  File "/var/local/git/grpc/src/python/grpcio_tests/tests/interop/methods.py", line 438, in _jwt_token_creds
    wanted_email = json.load(open(json_key_filename, 'rb'))['client_email']
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/json/__init__.py", line 268, in load
    parse_constant=parse_constant, object_pairs_hook=object_pairs_hook, **kw)
  File "/usr/lib/python3.4/json/__init__.py", line 312, in loads
    s.__class__.__name__))
TypeError: the JSON object must be str, not 'bytes'
```

https://github.com/grpc/grpc/blob/70ce9e21df4f6a18fbcfbb2103d1e89987125f4a/src/python/grpcio_tests/tests/interop/methods.py#L438
I fixed the python3 problem in methods.py

There's another python3 issue with the interop test, so I instead created https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/15658 which only addresses the build speed problem.

Here are a few more python3 problems:
https://source.cloud.google.com/results/invocations/3c31a5e3-ccd8-45b7-aebe-e863e7b55d3e/targets/github%2Fgrpc/tests

custom_metadata test is broken:
```

TypeError: Expected bytes, got str
```

I think i fixed all the problems, let's see what the tests say.

```
    bm_call_create.BM_IsolatedFilter_ClientChannelFilter_NoOp_.counters.new: 10
    bm_call_create.BM_IsolatedFilter_ClientChannelFilter_NoOp_.counters.old: 10


[microbenchmarks] No significant performance differences
```

@jtattermusch Your change looks good, and can you consider bump up the Python version to 3.7? There is an effort of migrating from Python 3.4 to Python 3.7. Ideally, it would be great to unify our testing Python version to 2.7 and 3.7.

Related issues:
* Eliminate use of Python 3.4 in all tests #13978
* Migrate tests from Python 3.4 to Python 3.7 #16995 
* Run performance tests with Python 3.7 #13505

Sure, I think I can help with the 3.4->3.7 bump, but I'm going to do that in a followup PR. (this PR is mostly about switching from python2->python3, the other PR is going to be mostly about playing with dockerfiles).
